snippet: Spain illustrates a flaw in the euro rules — fining a nation in financial trouble can only make matters worse.
abstract: News analysis; paradox in the Stability and Growth Pact, rules intended to maintain the stability of the euro by imposing fiscal discipline on member states, is illustrated by the situation in Spain, which is facing an economic squeeze; rules call for a fine, something that can only worsen a bad situation; however, while austerity could drive Spain over the edge, inaction could threaten the credibility of the rules when financial markets remain nervous.
lead_paragraph: Spain illustrates a flaw in the euro rules — fining a nation in financial trouble can only make matters worse.

headline.seo: Spain’s Deficit Tests Europe’s Financial Rules
headline.main: Spain’s Plea for Fiscal Leniency Challenges Rules
